description: Applications to Harvard College dropped 5% from a year ago, a symbolic blow to the school after a period of turmoil that included the resignation of its president and a defeat at the Supreme Court.
title: Harvard Applications Drop 5% After Tumultuous Year on Campus

description: Greek Prime Minister Kyriakos Mitsotakis survived a censure motion over his government’s handling of an investigation into the deadliest train accident in the country’s history.
title: Greek Premier Mitsotakis Survives Censure Motion on Train Crash

description: US military officials and their Israeli counterparts have discussed  only “broad concepts” about how to limit harm to civilians during a planned operation in the southern Gaza Strip city of Rafah, according to the chairman of the US Joint Chiefs of Staff.
title: US Wants More Detail on Israel’s Rafah Attack Plan, General Says

description: The president is campaigning on an industrial renaissance, but the bounty of jobs hasn’t landed in swing states crucial to his reelection bid.
title: 39,000 Lost Jobs Undercut Biden’s Manufacturing Wins

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, economy editor Reade Pickert looks ahead to the Fed’s preferred inflation indicator and comments by Jerome Powell. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Powell and Fresh Inflation Data Set to Crash Market Holiday

description: Brazil President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva called on the Venezuelan government of Nicolas Maduro to hold a fair presidential election in July, saying there was no explanation for the exclusion of an opposition candidate who was unable to register for the race this week.
title: Lula Calls on Ally Maduro to Hold Fair Elections in Venezuela

description: Israel’s Supreme Court has ordered the government to freeze funding to hundreds of religious seminaries beginning next week in a surprise blow to Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s governing coalition, which leans on ultra-Orthodox political parties.
title: Israel’s Top Court Freezes Seminary Funding, Rattling Government

description: Portugal’s incoming prime minister picked Joaquim Miranda Sarmento as finance minister, putting him in charge of fiscal policy for a government without a majority that can ensure approval of budgets.
title: Portugal’s New Premier Picks Sarmento as Finance Minister

description: The US, Germany and Japan are among more than a dozen countries that have suspended funding to the UN agency that supports Palestinian refugees, following allegations by Israel that 13 staffers were directly involved in the Oct. 7 Hamas attacks that killed some 1,200 people. Israel has long accused the UN Relief and Works Agency, or UNRWA, of giving cover to Hamas, which rules the Gaza Strip and is designated a terrorist group by the US and European Union. The US has suspended funding to UNRWA b
title: How the UNRWA Funding Boycott Threatens Gaza’s Aid Lifeline

description: South Africa’s Special Investigation Unit, established to tackle corruption and the misuse of public funds, asked the National Treasury to bar Oracle Corp. from doing business with the government because of what it says was a flawed tender.
title: Oracle Faces Blacklisting by South African Government Over Tender

description: The US Federal Trade Commission should enforce a rarely used antitrust law after finding that large retailers such as Amazon.com Inc. and Walmart Inc. increased profits during the Covid-19 pandemic and have kept prices high since, a group of lawmakers urged the agency.
title: Lawmakers Urge FTC to Enforce FDR-Era Law Over Grocery Price Bias

description: Brazil is readying measures to boost the country’s real estate market amid pressure from President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva to fuel economic growth.
title: Brazil Seeks Real Estate Market Boost as Lula Pushes for Growth

description: Texas regulators took a step toward terminating a 52-year toll road concession held by Actividades de Construccion y Servicios SA and restoring control to the state.
title: Texas Takes Step to Terminate Lucrative Houston Tollway Contract

description: Latvian authorities have arrested and plan to extradite to the US a local man over his work for a Kansas-based company in the alleged smuggling of avionics equipment through third countries destined for Russia, in violation of US export controls, the Justice Department said Wednesday.
title: US ‘Kleptocapture’ Group Seeks Russia Sanction Evaders Worldwide

description: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau said his government will set aside C$1 billion ($738 million) to provide low-cost loans for expanding and renovating child care spaces.
title: Trudeau Promises Low-Cost Loans to Expand Child Care Spaces

description: President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva intends to issue a provisional measure next week designed to lower Brazil’s electricity prices through the securitization of payments owed by the country’s largest power generation company, according to an official familiar with the plan.
title: Brazil Aims to Lower Electricity Bills With Eletrobras Funds

description: Senator Bernie Sanders wants to meet next week with Novo Nordisk A/S’s top executive about lowering the price of its blockbuster drug Ozempic, fueling controversy over the costs of GLP-1 drugs for diabetes and obesity.
title: Bernie Sanders Wants to Meet Novo CEO Next Week on Ozempic Price

description: Donald Trump cited a bogus social media account to make a false claim that the daughter of the New York judge presiding over his criminal hush-money trial had posted an image of the former president behind bars, according to a state court system spokesman.
title: Trump Bashed Judge’s Daughter on X Post. Court Says It’s Not Her

description: Keir Starmer’s deputy, Angela Rayner, plans to establish a powerful new department at the core of UK government to shore up her position if the opposition Labour Party wins the next general election.
title: Starmer’s No. 2 Angela Rayner Seeks New Power Base in Future Labour Government

description: The US ambassador to India said he wants to boost investment from American pension funds and private equity firms like KKR & Co. and Blackstone Inc. into the South Asian economy to take advantage of its rapid growth.
title: US Envoy Wants to Drive More Blackstone, KKR Investment to India

description: Russia vetoed a United Nations Security Council resolution to extend a panel of experts that has reported on North Korea’s development of its nuclear arsenal for 15 years, underscoring the increasingly close ties between Moscow and Pyonygang.
title: Russia Blocks UN’s Panel on North Korea’s Nuclear Program

description: Malawian legislators legalized the cultivation of a highly potent local variety of cannabis for industrial and medicinal use.
title: Potent Cannabis Strain Legalized in Malawi for Medicinal Use

description: Thailand took the first step toward legalizing casinos, as the government looks to attract high-spending tourists to support Southeast Asia’s second-largest economy while also checking revenue leak from illegal gambling.
title: Thailand Takes First Step to Legalize Casinos to Aid Economy

description: The dramatic replacement of Libya’s oil chief may help drive deals and revive the OPEC member’s beleaguered energy sector, but a fragmented political picture still leaves numerous hurdles for international firms to negotiate.
title: Libya’s Surprise Oil Minister Change Throws Spotlight on Output

description: Newly elected Senegalese President Bassirou Diomaye Faye plans to revisit the contracts of oil and gas projects developed by BP Plc, Kosmos Energy Ltd. and Woodside Energy Group Ltd. in order to boost revenue for the state.
title: Senegal’s New Leader Plans to Revisit Oil Deals with BP, Kosmos

description: Get caught up on the day’s political news
title: Big Nasties: Government Spending Squeeze And Local Budget Cuts

description: The US and UK are reviewing more than $20 billion of cryptocurrency transactions that passed through a Russia-based virtual exchange, according to people familiar with the matter, as part of allied efforts to crack down on the sanctions evasion that’s supporting Vladimir Putin’s war in Ukraine.
title: US and UK Probe $20 Billion of Crypto Transfers to Russian Exchange

description: Mexican billionaire Ricardo Salinas Pliego, a libertarian bitcoin believer who routinely mocks government “cavemen,” is ramping up a dispute with President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador over what he alleges is an inflated tax bill and the recent closure of a golf course in Oaxaca.
title: Billionaire Salinas Battles AMLO Over Taxes, Seized Golf Course

description: The moves are the first changes in a quarter century.
title: US Overhauls Race Data to Add Middle Eastern, Hispanic Categories

description: Latvian Foreign Minister Krisjanis Karins announced his resignation after mounting criticism and a criminal probe into his use of private jets during his tenure as prime minister.
title: Latvian Foreign Minister Karins Resigns Over Private Flights

description: There are few presidents in the world today with more radically different economic models than Argentina’s Javier Milei and Brazil’s Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva
title: Lula-Milei Clash Embodies the World’s Competing Economic Views

description: Roberto Campos Neto Photographer: Ton Molina/Bloomberg
title: Brazil’s Central Bank Increases Growth Estimate for 2024

description: When a Russian fuel tanker docks east of Havana this week, it will be welcome relief for Cuban officials trying to stymie growing unrest.
title: Russia Sends Cuba First Oil in a Year to Ease Blackouts and Unrest

description: A humanitarian disaster is unfolding in the Democratic Republic of Congo as fighting rages across the country’s mineral-rich eastern provinces, the head of the United Nations peacekeeping mission in the country told the Security Council.
title: ‘Unprecedented’ Humanitarian Crisis in Congo as Conflict Rages

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here. The newsletter is going on Easter break and will be back on Tuesday.
title: Venezuela’s President Maduro Is Running Rings Around the US

description: Representative Clay Higgins, a member of the House Homeland Security Committee, has asked Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen to “thoroughly review national security concerns” in the proposed sale of a US ammunition manufacturer to a firm based in the Czech Republic.
title: Yellen Asked to Probe Security Issues in Ammunition Maker’s Sale

description: Philippine President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. vowed “deliberate” countermeasures against “dangerous attacks” by Chinese ships in the South China Sea, and said he’s in talks with allies to help secure his country’s sovereignty.
title: Marcos Vows Countermeasures Against Attacks by China Vessels

description: A group of high-profile female lawyers demanded that London’s male only Garrick Club admit women, after a leaked membership list revealed a list of some of the most influential men across politics, law and entertainment.
title: Lawyers Demand London’s Men-Only Garrick Club Admit Women

description: President Joe Biden will raise $25 million in a one-day New York fundraising bonanza, flexing his political and organizational muscles in the face of Donald Trump.
title: Biden Grows Money Edge Over Trump With $25 Million New York Haul

description: The White House will require federal agencies to test artificial intelligence tools for potential risks and designate officers to ensure oversight, actions intended to encourage responsible adoption of the emerging technology by the US government.
title: Chief AI Officers, Bias Testing Are Now Required for US Federal Agencies

description: Venezuela’s President Nicolas Maduro has so brazenly disrespected his promise for free and fair elections that allies in Colombia and Brazil took to publicly condemning his crackdown on the opposition.
title: Maduro Tests Limits of Biden Administration’s Fair-Election Deal

description: South Africa’s main opposition party will resist forming a coalition with the ruling African National Congress in order to govern the country should it need to.
title: South Africa’s Main Opposition Leader Resists Coalition With ANC

description: Russian warships from the Pacific Fleet have crossed the Bab-el-Mandeb Strait and entered the Red Sea, the state-run Tass news agency said, venturing into a maritime region plagued by Houthi attacks and crowded with naval vessels.
title: Russian Navy Enters Warship-Crowded Red Sea Amid Houthi Attacks

description: Sri Lanka is hopeful it can resolve debt restructuring issues in the second quarter so it can get financing from the International Monetary Fund because external creditors are all engaging “positively,” according to the South Asian nation’s junior finance minister.
title: Sri Lanka Confident It’ll Meet Conditions for IMF Funding Soon

description: Bank of England rate setter Jonathan Haskel said interest-rate cuts should be “a long way off” in an interview with the Financial Times.
title: BOE’s Haskel Warns Against Rushing to Cut Interest Rates

description: A municipal election this weekend is a tight race between the Turkish president’s handpicked candidate and the opposition mayor.
title: Erdogan Seeks to Regain Istanbul and Vanquish His Nemesis

description: More UK Conservative Members of Parliament are standing down ahead of the looming general election than at any national vote since the party plunged to a landslide defeat in 1997.
title: UK Conservative MPs Flee ‘Sinking Ship’ Before General Election

description: Washington reiterated its call for India to carry out a fair and timely legal process following the arrest of the Delhi chief minister and the freezing of accounts for the South Asian country’s main opposition Congress party ahead of the national elections.
title: US Repeats Call for Fairness as India Targets Opposition Parties

description: A salvage crew climbing up a fire-ravaged ship lined with barbed wire. A French naval vessel fighting off combat drones. And seafarers navigating through the looming risks of encountering Somali pirates.
title: Houthi Ravaged Ship Was Caught Between Combat Drones and Pirates

description: China’s No. 3 leader took a veiled swipe at the US at a regional forum as the country seeks to push back against the global influence of the world’s leading power while trying to steady the countries’ ties at the same time.
title: China Rallies Asian Nations to Fight ‘Bullying’ in Jab at US

description: Bus drivers in South Korea’s capital ended their first strike in more than a decade, which knocked out service during the Thursday morning commute, after reaching a wage agreement with management.
title: Seoul Bus Drivers End Strike After Reaching Wage Deal

description: Colombia’s government expelled Argentine Embassy officials after President Javier Milei labeled Colombian counterpart Gustavo Petro a terrorist, assassin and communist in a TV interview.
title: Colombia Expels Argentine Officials After Milei Slams Petro

description: New Zealand expects China to respect its right to an independent foreign policy as it explores joining the Aukus security pact between Australia, the US and UK, Foreign Minister Winston Peters said.
title: New Zealand Expects China’s Respect As It Explores Joining Aukus

description: The huge scale of the spending demands facing the next UK government is laid bare in a new report by the head of an influential parliamentary committee.
title: UK Watchdog Lists Spending ‘Nasties’ Awaiting Next Government
